title: Mercedes and Porsche Squeezed by U.S. Tariffs and Slowdown in China
summary: Germany’s leading luxury automakers are sharply scaling back expectations for the rest of the year.

title: Trump Administration Told Taiwan’s President to Avoid U.S. Stopover
summary: The Taiwanese leader canceled U.S. transit visits after being urged to change his plans, two officials said. Washington has been in talks with Beijing over trade and a possible summit.

title: U.S. Economy Slowed in First Half of 2025 as Tariffs Scrambled Data
summary: Gross domestic product rebounded in the spring after contracting at the start of the year, but consumer spending remained weak.

title: Trump’s Tax Bill Expands Farm Subsidies. Not All Farmers Will Benefit.
summary: A $60 billion boost to farm subsidies will be a lifeline to some. But the way the funding will be distributed could worsen disparities between farms in an industry already struggling with consolidation.

title: Texas Republicans Unveil Gerrymandered House Map, Trying to Please Trump
summary: The proposed map would give Republicans a chance to gain five U.S. House seats, including in Houston, Dallas and along the U.S.-Mexican border.

title: An Evening at the Office, and Four Lives Ended by Gunfire
summary: A police officer. A security guard. An executive. An associate. They were remembered for their “light,” for their passion and commitment.

title: Mamdani Returns From Uganda and Visits Slain Officer’s Family
summary: Zohran Mamdani, the Democratic candidate for mayor of New York City, visited the home of a police officer who was killed in a mass shooting in Midtown Manhattan on Monday.

title: NYC Gunman Brings Issue of C.T.E. to NFL’s Door
summary: Shane Tamura never played in the league, but the police believe he was seeking vengeance over the handling of head injuries in football.

title: Jason Momoa Prefers to Be Called a ‘Sensitive Alpha Male’
summary: For “Chief of War,” the actor went from playing fictional superheroes to a real one in this epic passion project set in Hawaii.

title: Pilots for Army Black Hawk Discussed Changing Course Before Crash
summary: The maneuver might have taken the helicopter out of the direct path of a passenger jet as it was trying to land at Reagan Airport on Jan. 29.

title: The Biggest Unanswered Questions About the Reagan Airport Crash
summary: Six months after a midair collision killed 67 people outside Washington, transportation safety officials will hear testimony from the key players whose pilots were involved in the accident.

title: Confirmation Slowdown Forces a Senate Showdown
summary: Under pressure to show they are resisting President Trump, Democrats have insisted on recorded votes on every nominee, creating a bottleneck ahead of the August recess.

title: House Democrats Sue ICE for Barring Them From Detention Facilities
summary: The 12 Democrats accused the Trump administration of violating the law when it turned them away from immigrant detention sites and imposed a new policy limiting congressional access.

title: Top F.D.A. Official Resigns Under Pressure
summary: After turning down several new drugs and restricting use of another, Dr. Vinay Prasad drew the ire of the right-wing influencer Laura Loomer and others.

title: Canada’s Measles Cases Surpass U.S., Alberta Officials Push for State of Emergency
summary: Some doctors in Alberta have criticized officials for not declaring a health emergency in the western province where measles infections are surging.

title: Trump’s Mideast Envoy Heads to Israel Amid Global Fury Over Gaza Hunger
summary: It will be the first known visit in months for Steve Witkoff, President Trump’s lead on the cease-fire and hostage talks. Since his last trip, conditions in the enclave have worsened.

title: A Seaside Refuge in Gaza, Torn Apart by an Israeli Strike
summary: The Israeli military said it killed at least three Hamas operatives at Al-Baqa Cafe. It also killed a journalist, an artist and two best friends reconciling after a fight.

title: Brennan and Clapper: The Trump Administration Is Rewriting History of Russia and 2016
summary: We want to set the record straight and also sound a warning.

title: They Saw Their Neighbors Taken Away by ICE. Then They Made a Plan.
summary: The movement against ICE in Los Angeles — one that is starting to take root across the country — demonstrates a shift from symbolic protest to direct action.

title: Football’s Brain Injuries
summary: We explain what we know about the disease after the shooting in Manhattan.

title: Colbert Mocks Presidential Memo About Religious Conversions at Work
summary: Despite the Trump administration’s support for proselytizing at the office, Stephen Colbert doesn’t think it’s a good idea.

title: Powerful Earthquake Rattles Russia’s Far East But Causes Little Damage
summary: A 8.8-magnitude earthquake shook the remote, sparsely populated Kamchatka region and set off tsunami waves. No serious injuries were reported, officials said.

title: Ozzy Osbourne’s Coffin Is Taken Through His Hometown’s Streets Before Funeral
summary: A cortege took the singer’s coffin through the streets of his hometown, Birmingham, England, on Wednesday.

title: Laura Dahlmeier, Gold Medal-Winning German Biathlete, Dies in Rockfall
summary: Ms. Dahlmeier, 31, an experienced mountaineer, was climbing in Pakistan when she was hit by falling rocks, officials said.

title: Company That Owns Apartments.com Sues Zillow Over Rental Listing Photos
summary: The chief executive of CoStar Group, which owns Apartments.com, said Zillow has ‘stolen’ thousands of images to bolster its business.
